1610227365_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
If you have to choose a side... far left, far right, which would you choose?

That time may be coming faster than you think. And dont forget-

"If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality."
-Desmond Tutu

Thats my point. We are headed for a fork in the road. In fact half (third if you drop independents) of the population is straddling either side of the crossroad. Its Hegelian back and forth between which group holds power, each time controlling new institutions or destroying those that cant be controlled. 

Soon we will have to choose a side. Socialism or corporate/gov """private-public partnership (TM)""" in fact they are largely the same outcome just with different processes. One is rooted in the social theory of neo-liberalism/globalism and the other in the social theory of libertarianism, free-market, yah?

> [jager](#comment_18_1MCNYstff4yDsoNktn2MzGbtsCHqnRxHWX): Because the far-left is like...what exactly?

is that rhetorical? There is much nuance right? I think ""true far left (TM)"" is rooted in anarchism and socialism. Its all about rights of individuals (counter-intuitive, eh?). When there is a power differential between workers and their employers it leads to the problems the great socialist thinkers like Marx, accurately commented on (IMO). 

I think the """far left ModErn LiBeRAl/P R O G R E S S I V E (TM)" is rooted in collectivism, central planning, Keynesian economics, MMT. 

I feel antifa is largely made up... kinda like the dreaded ISIS. Just a patchwork and really not much organization. Though I have some researching to do on that. I feel nancy pelosi, biden, etc are the modern liberal. AOC/bernie/yang are somewhere between. The true far left dont have modern celebrities just personalities. Kinda like the """alt-right (TM)""" has.

> [jager](#comment_20_1MCNYstff4yDsoNktn2MzGbtsCHqnRxHWX): Antifa is largely made up? Right. It is pure coincidence that they show up at the same time/place, same clothes, same weapons, and coordinated tactics. Pay NO attention to the antifa subreddit or their Telegram groups. Totally made up. If that is made up, then basically every identitarian affiliation is made up. What would it take for you to acknowledge it as an organization? A membership card or pin or something? [...]

But do you believe antifa is a threat to... anything? They seem to me not unlike 'occupy.' Theyre largely university students. Its essentially a LARP, no? I mean Ive personally observed these people at protests. The media makes it look big and scary. But in Hegelion way they do they same to the """""InSUrrECTiOnistS (TM)""""" "armed militias at 50 CAPITALS REEEE."

Marx and others got some things right when they predicted how capitalism would end- an ultra elite ownership class and the rest of the population who hopefully are able to work or earn capital. The idea of "means of production" has merit IMO. We dont need one person to own a global network or manufacturing company. Likewise we dont need one person to have so much capital that they could equally purchase a global network or manufacturing company. 

I find that most people in the real world, at least in my neighborhood are pretty normal folks. Its gotten a bit polarized (understatement) but there is certainly a spectrum with a healthy percentage of critical thinkers in the middle. Even the extremists I can find common ground on.

1610501785_12BSeHrHaz9gyid4AFkYdFYRcmFsS.body:
Actually Zeronet has been around for quite some time. 2015 according to wiki. And its had its ups and its downs in terms of user activity. 

I think it comes down to a few things when comparing platforms:
1) How is the platform built? Blockchain, open source, centralized servers (AWS), clearnet, app, phone number required for sign-up?
2) How active is it?

Zeronet fits 1 very nicely IMO. for 2 its on the less active side. But compare to Gab which is hugely popular right now but barely functions (Andrew and team are doing a great job considering the sudden influx). Gab runs on private hardware. 

Zeronet is good to pop in once and a while if youre not actively using zites beyond ZeroTalk. Either it becomes popular organically or someday we may find ourselves grateful if other sites are shut down and Zeronet remains an option.
